description:
Project management involves initiation, planning, development, organising, implementation, delivering, finalising, situational problem solving and creative leadership. Practical activities and methods and techniques for solid decision-making and trust are compelling, artful application of communication, negotiation, and people skills are needed. Technical and business resources has to be agreed upon, multiple stakeholders, customers and project teams have to be proficiently managed and satisfied, the project has to be monitored and controlled with multiple measurements and standards to meet costs, time and priorities.

This course contain the next topics:

1. Why use a methodology

2. Types of PM Methodologies

- PMP

- SCRUM

- PRINCE2

- Lean 6 Sigma

- BPM

3. Tailoring, Mixing and Tools

A few word about the author of this course Asen Tsonev:

- 9 years project management experience in multinational companies (IT, Management Consulting, Banking, Insurance)

- Deliver in-house trainings on Project Management, Process Improvement and Lean Six Sigma

- Interested in “Value creation/Business Models”, “Efficient and Effective” “Education, Learning, Application”, “Business Trends”

- PDMS, BIS, Health Management, PMP, Lean Six Sigma

And his moto is: “I try more ways, more frequently and persist longer than average”
title: Project Management Methodologies
